ModMetaData.name: What's Wrong - Colonist Needs Tracker
ModMetaData.author: ProgrammerLily
ModMetaData.description:
What's Wrong - Colonist Needs Tracker is a powerful utility mod for RimWorld 1.6 that helps you keep your colony running smoothly by tracking all unmet needs across your colonists in real time.
Features: • Adds a dedicated tab to the main UI, accessible at any time, showing a summary of all colonists with unmet needs (food, rest, recreation, medical, mood, and more). • Instantly see which colonists are missing critical resources, such as beds, tables, chairs, food, recreation sources, and more. • Click any need in the tracker window to jump directly to the affected colonist for fast intervention. • Provides actionable tutorial hints and designator shortcuts to help you resolve common issues (e.g., build a stove, place a table, create a growing zone). • Supports modded content: detects needs and objects from popular expansions and mods, including Royalty, Biotech, and Vanilla Expanded modules. • Smart detection for special zones (growing, fishing, stockpile, dumping) and modded buildings. • Fully compatible with RimWorld 1.6 and future updates. • Lightweight, performance-friendly, and designed for both new and veteran players.
Usage: - Open the "What's Wrong" tab at the bottom of the screen to view all unmet needs. - Click on any listed need to jump to the colonist or open the relevant build/designator menu. - Use the provided hints to quickly address issues before they escalate.
Compatibility: - Works with all major DLCs and most mods that add new needs or buildings. - No game balance changes; purely a UI and utility enhancement.
For feedback, bug reports, or suggestions, please visit the mod's GitHub page or Steam Workshop listing. Github: https://github.com/sam2332/Rimworld-WhatsWrong
